wikipedia_page.main: Admiral Leveson Eliot Henry Somerset (29 August 1829 – 7 February 1900) was a British Royal Navy officer who served as second-in-command of the Channel Squadron 1880-1881.

response: *Adm. Leveson Eliot Henry Somerset (29 August 1829 – 7 February 1900), married Efah, daughter of Col. Hon. Richard Thomas Rowley, without issue

In a change of scene in May 1851 she sailed to North America and the West Indies under Captain Colin Yorke Campbell. From 1853 to 1858 she stayed in the West Indies under successive command of: Algernon Frederick Rous de Horsey; Edward Marshall; Leveson Eliot Henry Somerset; Charles Wake; and John Kennedy Erskine Baird.
